body:
I can't remember if I replied to this or not. I am old.

Anyway, Thomas, RAYPATH is indeed set correctly. We are considering dropping support for WindowsXP at this point, seeing as how it's almost as old as I am, and these scripts work fine on Windows7 (soon to be supplanted by Windows8). The reason I replied to the list is because I'm curious:

Is anyone running Radiance on WindowsXP anymore? Email me offlist (robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov) if you have a sec, listers. Just trying to get a sense of how many XP/Radiance users are out there.


Rob Guglielmetti  IESNA, LEED AP
Commercial Buildings Research Group
National Renewable Energy Laboratory
15013 Denver West Parkway MS:RSF202
Golden, CO 80401
303.275.4319
robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov


On 7/20/12 11:31 AM, "Thomas Bleicher" <tbleicher at googlemail.com<mailto:tbleicher at googlemail.com>> wrote:

I think I had the same error during testing. After I set RAYPATH to the lib folder in the new installation it worked fine. Is your RAYPATH set correctly at the cmd prompt? I also did not use any arguments like "-m 1" for testing.

Thomas

On Fri, Jul 20, 2012 at 5:54 PM, Guglielmetti, Robert <Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov<mailto:Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov>> wrote:
Hi Thomas,

Thanks for the research! Unfortunately, this workaround resulted in this mess:

Hmmm?

C:\>gensky 6 21 12 | perl -S genskyvec.pl<http://genskyvec.pl> -m 1
Access is denied.
